entry.title: postcard wall
music review
My Postcrossing Life
entry.content:
Recently,Iâ€™ve exchanged postcards on instagram and facebook,here is my outgoing.I just created an Instagram account yesterday to connect with people for postcard exchanges. However, after sending a few DMs, my account was suddenly restricted. I immediately submitted an appeal and anxiously waited, assuming I might lose the account for good. To my surprise, it was restored within an hour! The experience made me cautiousâ€”Iâ€™ll avoid aggressive liking or messaging for now.

Work has been quiet today, with little on my plate. I considered sourcing some products, but many items are hard to find reliable Chinese suppliers for, as theyâ€™re rarely manufactured locally.

This week, Iâ€™m excited to attend a collaborative postcard meet-up activity in Chengdu for my first time! I met fellow enthusiasts and writing postcards together.

entry.title: my body training record
entry.content:
First Training Session 21th April

for didnâ€™t do 18th Aprilâ€™s record, so begin with 21th April.
Todayâ€™s Focus: Back + Cardio
Highlights of This Session:
âœ” Lat Pulldown â€“ Excellent engagement of the teres major and latissimus dorsi, full range of motion with proper lat stretch. ğŸ‘
âœ” V-Bar Pulldown â€“ Stable and controlled movement, great lat activation. ğŸ‘
âœ” Cardio Training â€“ Completed with good intensity and proper energy expenditure without overexertion. ğŸ‘

Post-Session Notes:

  • Maintain consistent training to improve endurance and build a foundation for future cardio sessions.
  • Adjust your dietâ€”avoid high-calorie meals at night.

Second Training Session 23th April

Todayâ€™s Focus: Shoulders + Fat-Burning

Highlights of This Session:
âœ” Smith Machine Shoulder Press â€“ Empty bar, 4 sets âœ…
âœ” 2kg Lateral Raises + Resistance Band â€“ 20 reps, 4 sets âœ…
âœ” 2.5kg Face Pulls â€“ 4 sets âœ…
âœ” Crunches â€“ 25 reps, 2 sets âœ…
âœ” Medicine Ball Press â€“ 30 sec, 3 sets âœ…

Areas for Improvement:

  • Muscle strength and endurance need work.
  • Cardio capacity requires further development.
  • Consistency will lead to progress.

Post-Session Notes:

  • Keep meals lightâ€”low oil, salt, and carbs.
  • Increase protein intake for balanced nutrition.
  • Get enough rest!

Third Training Session 30th April

Todayâ€™s Focus: Glute Training

Highlights of This Session:
âœ” Seated Hip Abduction (Adjusted Form) â€“ Successfully targeted the upper glutes, better mind-muscle connection. ğŸ‘
âœ” Hip Thrusts â€“ Quick learning progress, strong activation of the mid-lower glutes.
âœ” Cardio Training â€“ Excellent performance, noticeable improvement in endurance and fitness level!

Post-Session Notes:

  • A slight feeling of hunger before bed can aid fat loss.
  • Stay consistentâ€”progress is guaranteed with persistence!

Fourth Training Session 6th May

Training Theme: Back + Abs + Cardio

Todayâ€™s Highlights:

  • Lat Pulldown weight breakthrough to 20kgâ€”strong activation of the teres major/minor and lats, with smooth movement execution!
  • V-Bar Pulldown had excellent backward lean, maximizing lat engagement and minimizing arm compensation.
  • Battle Ropes maintained a perfect forward-leaning angle, shifting the center of gravity to challenge stability and increase calorie burn.

Todayâ€™s Session:

  • Lat Pulldown 20kg âœ… 4 sets
  • V-Bar Pulldown 20kg âœ… 4 sets
  • Seated Row 7.5kg âœ… 4 sets
  • Crunches 15 reps âœ… 4 sets
  • Jumping Jacks 25 reps âœ… 2 sets
  • High Knees 25 reps âœ… 2 sets
  • Battle Ropes 30 sec âœ… 2 sets
  • Burpees 12 reps âœ… 1 set
  • Lying Leg Raises 12 reps âœ… 2 sets

Areas for Improvement:
Core strength is still lacking, making it difficult to perform lower-ab exercises effectively. Continued focus on progression is needed.

Post-Workout Notes:

  • Stretch regularly at home to improve lumbar and abdominal mobility, which will enhance training performance.
  • Current diet and training consistency are on trackâ€”just maintain steady workout frequency!

Fifth Training Session 9th May

Training Focus: Chest + Core & Cardio Endurance

  • Incline Dumbbell Press: 3kg 15 reps âœ… 4 sets
  • Medicine Ball Slam + Burpees: 45 sec (1 set + 5 burpees) âœ… 5 sets
  • Sled Push: 30kg loaded 1 round tripâœ… 4 sets
  • Jumping Jacks: 45 sec âœ… 4 sets
  • Hanging Leg Raise: Bodyweight 15 repsâœ… 4 sets

Highlights of This Session:
Initially struggled with the Mountain Climbers, but quickly adapted after a few adjustments.

Areas for Improvement:

  • Maintain chest up & core engaged during exercises.
  • Stabilize scapula properly to avoid compensation from traps and shoulders.

Post-Workout Notes:

  • Stretch gastrocnemius & hamstrings thoroughly.
  • Follow a light diet, ensure adequate sleep, and stay hydrated.

Hereâ€™s the professional translation of your training log into English, keeping the original structure and tone while ensuring accuracy in fitness terminology:

sixth Training Session 13th May

Training Focus: Glutes + Core

  • Seated Hip Abduction: 28-32kg âœ… 4 sets Ã— 15 reps
  • Wide-Stance Smith Machine Squat: 5kg âœ… 4 sets Ã— 10-12 reps
  • Hip Thrust: 17kg âœ… 4 sets Ã— 12 reps
  • Sumo Squat: 7.5kg âœ… 4 sets Ã— 8 reps
  • Crunches: 30 reps âœ… 2 sets

Highlights:

  • Quick mastery of the wide-stance Smith machine squat!
  • Pushed through the final superset of hip thrusts even at failure!

Areas for Improvement:

  • Smith Machine Squat: Reduce knee dominance; focus on sitting back (â€œlike sitting on a toiletâ€).
  • Sumo Squat: Externally rotate knees slightly, aligning them with the 2nd/3rd toes.
  • Gradually adjust breathing rhythm.
  • Core strength needs work.

Post-Session Notes:

  • Maintain a low-oil, low-sodium diet; avoid greasy foods.
  • Stretch and relax if muscle soreness occurs the next day.
  • ğŸ’¥ STRICT DIET CONTROL IS CRUCIAL!!!

seventh Training Session 15th May

Training Focus: Upper Body + Core + Cardio

Exercises:

  • Hip Hinge Jump Press: 7kg âœ… 20 reps Ã— 4 sets
  • Dumbbell Fly: 1kg âœ… 4 sets
  • Lat Pulldown: 12kg âœ… 12 reps Ã— 4 sets
  • Sandbag Lateral Step Rotation: 7kg âœ… 4 sets Ã— 45 sec
  • Cross Crunches: Bodyweight âœ… 30 reps Ã— 4 sets
  • Plank: 30 sec Ã— 1 set

Highlights:

  • Excellent training rhythm and quick movement pattern adaptation.
  • Significant cardiovascular improvement!

Areas for Improvement:

  • Pressing Movements: Stabilize scapula to prevent shrugging/compensation.

Post-Workout Notes:

  • Clean eating (reduce carbs, increase protein).
  • Prioritize sleep quality; perform static glute/leg stretches before bed.
  • Next session: Complete missed cardio portion.

entry.title: farm
entry.content: We went to the countryside to plant peanuts today. The breeze was cool and refreshing, but I just stood by and watched as they worked the fields. My dad was using a needle to inject liquid into a tree, causing it to die. We bought two kilograms of peanuts, and after planting, only a few taels remained. They were planted on a slope, and my grandmother hoed the ground, her face dripping with sweat.here is the farm we worked on.
